SUMMARY: EnvY is a DNA-binding transcriptional regulator that participates in control of several genes that encode cellular envelope proteins at low temperatures and during stationary phase [6317653]. This protein is an envelope protein [6317653]that contains a putative membrane-spanning region, and as for members of family of transcriptional regulators (AraC/XylS) that it pertains to [8451183] it also contains a helix-turn-helix motif for DNA binding in C-terminal region [8451183, 7503752]. transcriptional regulators of E. coli that show higher similarity to EnvR are AppY and AdiY [7503752]. latter, like EnvY, also has a putative transmembrane region [7503752]. No research has been done to determine DNA-binding sites for EnvY. regulation of envY has not been described yet, but a region of dyad symmetry has been found upstream of this gene [8704970]. EnvY: envelope polypeptide [6317653].
